column4: funny how we suddenly discuss viruses instead of useability :)
coz you were cornered?
very trivial.. the saga continues
i can't play frozen-bubble on windows
i don't need to discuss windows, I know everything there is to know about windows :)
godmachine, compile source.. sounds like the right way for gamers!
godmachine, i'm not gonna bother arguing :)
i don't want to learn my OS, i want my OS to be a transparent layer that allows me to run my _apps_
big band?
every windows user is a troll according to linuxers :)
no, they are not, but can we move on now, please?
I'm not sure what you have tried yet. usually   sudo apt-get install frozen-bubble  does it
http://www.frozen-bubble.org/downloads/ .. can you install that one?
it's really easier to use that line to install it on ubuntu
what line
sudo apt-get install frozen-bubble
and then I get this kind of error: https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+source/frozen-bubble/+bug/1292
Are you using Breezy? If not, your sources.list is out of date
https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+source/frozen-bubble/+bug/1292 is not an error you get on edgy, please point us to the real error you get
it's as close as it gets... it says libsdl-perl is not installable
can you pastebin your sources.list?
sorry no
then, sorry, I cannot help you further
if you are using edgy, as a last resort you can get that package from this page: http://packages.ubuntu.com/edgy/perl/libsdl-perl
